item.description: Please, please, please do not cite narrative reviews for your (potentially contentious) claims, even if you are a public health agency. Especially if you are a public health agency. https://t.co/VFTUlDLeOK https://t.co/XyPT6vSMmg

item.description: Nassim Taleb is a tough act to follow, but this 90-minute primer on covid was A+. A tiny quibble (I have to, I‚Äôm sorry): A.F. discouraging mask use was more a misguided attempt to manage the shortage than an evidence-based rec. Backfired, obviously. https://t.co/AkQexrNwfl

item.description: This 90-minute conversation between @trishankkarthik and @stephen_wolfram goes great with a Sunday espresso. Familiarity with Wolfram's prior work preferred but not required, thanks to the work Trishank's put in preparing. https://t.co/FVKULM6I7t

item.description: "Watching the pandemic unfold, and watching what people have said and not said about it, I have to say I'm pretty unimpressed [with IQ]. If people who were filtered down to do that stuff were filtered by an IQ filter, it did a really bad job." -S. Wolfram https://t.co/l7u8zamzRe
item.source:markdown: "Watching the pandemic unfold, and watching what people have said and not said about it, I have to say I'm pretty unimpressed [with IQ]. item.description: @ArieHaziza @nntaleb True! And we are surrounded by wall-to-wall BS, no matter your profession, no matter where you live. Once you see it you can't unsee it.
item.source:markdown: @ArieHaziza @nntaleb True! And we are surrounded by wall-to-wall BS, no matter your profession, no matter where you live. Once you see it you can't unsee it.

item.description: "There was a time when academia was society's refuge for the eccentric, brilliant, and impractical. No longer. It is now the domain of professional self-marketers." https://t.co/HEPmIWVtvY

item.description:
@otrasenda_AC @NahanniFinanci1 @nntaleb @GGCanto Hm, not sure how the fence paradox would apply to lanes‚Ä¶ Cyclists and/or drivers becoming less careful/not aggressive because of the separation? Is there data to suggest it going one way or the other (same city before/after lanes, or otherwise similar cities with/without)?

@otrasenda_AC @NahanniFinanci1 @nntaleb @GGCanto Not=more (typo). There are many plausible narratives for why lanes would be good or bad, but this reminds me of some saying in spring 2020 that masks may increase infections because of false sense of security. Well, sure, possible but unlikely, so let‚Äôs look at the data.
@NahanniFinanci1 @nntaleb @GGCanto Sounds like a good reason to petition for more lanes! (but I imagine an e-bike would be a hazard in that environment‚Ä¶)
item.source:markdown: @NahanniFinanci1 @nntaleb @GGCanto Sounds like a good reason to petition for more lanes! (but I imagine an e-bike would be a hazard in that environment‚Ä¶)

item.description: @eliowa Excellent point. Another one is: how does this compare to other viruses? SARS-CoV-1? Endemic coronaviruses? Adeno or rhinoviruses? EBV? There is so much opportunity here to learn about viral effects and prevention in general that we are missing because of hyperfocus on covid.
item.source:markdown: @eliowa Excellent point. Another one is: how does this compare to other viruses? SARS-CoV-1? Endemic coronaviruses? Adeno or rhinoviruses? EBV? There is so much opportunity here to learn about viral effects and prevention in general that we are missing because of hyperfocus on covid.

item.description: @nntaleb @GGCanto Yep, bike lanes are still key, with or without pedal assist. DC has smartly put them in quieter side streets. That way you only need to worry about drunk restaurant patrons, not so much cars. https://t.co/EcIFZ86LbF
item.source:markdown: @nntaleb @GGCanto Yep, bike lanes are still key, with or without pedal assist. DC has smartly put them in quieter side streets. That way you only need to worry about drunk restaurant patrons, not so much cars. https://t.co/EcIFZ86LbF

item.description:
Here is another example of problems with large scale for #RWRI17. ‚ÄúScholars in fields where many papers are published annually face difficulty getting published, read, and cited unless their work references already widely cited articles.‚Äù -> the field stagnates. https://t.co/EQuGVPH64g

From the thread‚Ä¶ May be the reason why @DrCirillo and @nntaleb had to publish their their paper titled "Tail risks of contagious diseases" in Nature Physics https://t.co/5mCs3U5HYs
item.source:markdown:
Here is another example of problems with large scale for #RWRI17. ‚ÄúScholars in fields where many papers are published annually face difficulty getting published, read, and cited unless their work references already widely cited articles.‚Äù -> the field stagnates. https://t.co/EQuGVPH64g
From the thread‚Ä¶ May be the reason why @DrCirillo and @nntaleb had to publish their their paper titled "Tail risks of contagious diseases" in Nature *Physics* https://t.co/5mCs3U5HYs

item.description: Hypothesis: the ability for patients to freely communicate with their physicians via an EMR messaging system is a scam perpetrated upon both, one that leads to physician burnout and, ultimately, less satisfied patients.
item.source:markdown: Hypothesis: the ability for patients to freely communicate with their physicians via an EMR messaging system is a scam perpetrated upon both, one that leads to physician burnout and, ultimately, less satisfied patients.
